pages.title: Page Not Found | Mifty Framework
pages.description: Discover Mifty Framework - the enterprise-grade Node.js TypeScript framework that accelerates backend development. Build scalable modular applications with visual database designer, auto code generation, and seamless Prisma integration. Start building robust APIs today.

pages.title: App Class | Mifty Framework
pages.description: The App class is the main application class that orchestrates the initialization and configuration of your Mifty application.

pages.title: BaseController | Mifty Framework
pages.description: The BaseController is an abstract class that provides a complete set of CRUD operations for your API endpoints. It handles request validation, response formatting, and error handling automatically.
recommendations: Description: Description should include primary keywords

pages.title: BaseRepository | Mifty Framework
pages.description: The BaseRepository is an abstract class that implements the repository pattern for data access operations. It provides a standardized interface for database operations using Prisma ORM.
recommendations: Description: Description should include primary keywords

pages.title: BaseService | Mifty Framework
pages.description: The BaseService is an abstract class that provides a standardized service layer implementation with business logic validation and error handling. It acts as an intermediary between controllers and repositories.
recommendations: Description: Description should include primary keywords

pages.title: Repository Decorator | Mifty Framework
pages.description: The Repository Decorator provides automatic error handling and logging for repository operations.
recommendations: Description: Description should include primary keywords

pages.title: PaginatedResult Interface | Mifty Framework
pages.description: The PaginatedResult interface defines the structure for paginated query results in the Mifty framework. It provides metadata about pagination along with the actual data.

pages.title: IRepository Interface | Mifty Framework
pages.description: The IRepository interface defines the contract for data access operations in the Mifty framework. It provides a standardized set of methods for CRUD operations, searching, and pagination.

pages.title: SearchOptions Interface | Mifty Framework
pages.description: The SearchOptions interface defines the structure for query parameters used in search and pagination operations throughout the Mifty framework.

pages.title: IService Interface | Mifty Framework
pages.description: The IService interface defines the contract for service layer operations in the Mifty framework. It provides a standardized set of methods for business logic operations, acting as an intermediary between controllers and repositories.

pages.title: Application Loaders | Mifty Framework
pages.description: The Mifty framework uses a loader pattern to initialize different aspects of the application in the correct order. Loaders handle dependency injection, Express configuration, database connections, and route loading.

pages.title: API Response Utilities | Mifty Framework
pages.description: The API Response utilities provide standardized response formatting for REST API endpoints in the Mifty framework. They ensure consistent response structure across all endpoints.

pages.title: Logger Utility | Mifty Framework
pages.description: The Logger utility provides structured logging capabilities using Winston with daily log rotation and environment-specific configuration.
recommendations: Description: Description should include primary keywords

pages.title: RequestOptionBuilder Utility | Mifty Framework
pages.description: The RequestOptionBuilder utility provides methods for parsing and validating query parameters from HTTP requests, converting them into structured options for database queries.

pages.title: API Reference | Mifty Framework
pages.description: Welcome to the Mifty Framework API Reference. This section provides comprehensive documentation for all core modules, interfaces, and utilities available in the Mifty framework.

pages.title: Database Patterns | Mifty Framework
pages.description: Common database design patterns and best practices used in Mifty applications.

pages.title: Dependency Injection Pattern | Mifty Framework
pages.description: Dependency Injection (DI) in Mifty provides a clean way to manage dependencies between classes, making your code more testable, maintainable, and flexible. The framework uses a container-based approach to automatically resolve and inject dependencies.

pages.title: Error Handling Patterns | Mifty Framework
pages.description: Mifty provides a comprehensive error handling system with structured exceptions, automatic error transformation, and consistent error responses. The framework uses a hierarchical exception system that provides detailed error information while maintaining security.

pages.title: Repository Pattern | Mifty Framework
pages.description: The Repository pattern in Mifty provides a clean abstraction layer between your business logic and data access logic. It encapsulates the logic needed to access data sources, centralizing common data access functionality for better maintainability and decoupling.

pages.title: Service Layer Pattern | Mifty Framework
pages.description: The Service Layer pattern in Mifty provides a clean separation between business logic and data access. Services act as an intermediary layer that orchestrates business operations, validates business rules, and coordinates between controllers and repositories.

pages.title: Database Configuration | Mifty Framework
pages.description: Mifty supports all major databases through Prisma ORM. You can easily switch between databases by simply changing the provider in your Prisma schema and updating your connection string - no code changes required!

pages.title: Manual Schema Editing | Mifty Framework
pages.description: For developers who prefer code-first approach or need advanced control, you can directly edit the src/db.design.ts file. This method provides more flexibility and is perfect for complex schemas, version control, and team collaboration.

pages.title: Visual Database Designer | Mifty Framework
pages.description: Mifty's Visual Database Designer is a powerful drag-and-drop interface that lets you design your database schema without writing any code. It automatically generates Prisma schemas and keeps your db.design.ts file in sync.

pages.title: Architecture Overview | Mifty Framework
pages.description: Mifty Framework follows a Clean Architecture pattern with Dependency Injection, providing a scalable, maintainable, and testable foundation for enterprise Node.js applications.

pages.title: Code Generation Capabilities | Mifty Framework
pages.description: Mifty's powerful code generation system automatically creates complete, production-ready modules from your database design. This eliminates hours of boilerplate coding and ensures consistent, high-quality code across your application.
